credits.infomessage: Income Management: Track, Record and Analyze Your Income for Effective Financial Management.

description.accounts: Manage your financial accounts, add new accounts, view balance, and transaction history for each account.
description.income: Keep track of your monthly and additional sources of income. Add incomes from various sources and monitor your overall income.
description.expenses: Track all your expenses, categorize them, and monitor where you spend the most. Plan your budget more effectively.
description.credits: Manage your loans and credits. Make payments, track remaining balances, and monitor repayment schedules.
description.planning: Create and track your financial goals, set budgets for specific expense categories, and monitor their progress.
description.reports: Receive detailed reports about your financial status, analyze trends, and draw conclusions for more effective financial management.

item.Title: Budgeting
Tips: Develop a monthly budget, including all your expenses and income.
Track your financial transactions to understand where your money is going.

item.Title: Spending Priorities
Tips: Set priorities for your spending, prioritizing essential needs over desired purchases.
Categorize expenses into mandatory, necessary, and additional to better plan your budget.

item.Title: Saving on Everyday Expenses
Tips: Look for ways to save on everyday expenses, such as food, transportation, and entertainment.
Consider using discounts, deals, and loyalty programs to reduce expenses.

item.Title: Financial Goals
Tips: Set specific financial goals, such as savings for emergencies, vacations, or large purchases.
Develop a plan to achieve your financial goals and monitor its implementation.

item.Title: Avoiding Excess
Tips: Avoid excess and unnecessary spending, considering the necessity of each purchase.
Prefer quality over quantity and make thoughtful purchases.

item.Title: Regular Budget Review
Tips: Periodically review your budget, taking into account changes in income and expenses.
Make adjustments to the budget to reflect your current financial situation.

item.Title: Financial Education
Tips: Invest time in financial education to better understand your options and make informed financial decisions.
Read books, attend webinars, and consult with financial experts when necessary.

accounts.Title: Create a Budget
Tips: Define your monthly expenses and income.
Divide your budget into categories (groceries, housing, transportation, entertainment, etc.).

accounts.Title: Open Different Accounts
Tips: Separate your accounts into several categories, such as checking account, savings account, emergency fund account, etc.

accounts.Title: Keep Cash for Small Expenses
Tips: Allocate a certain amount for cash expenses each month.
Use cash for small purchases and expenses to avoid excessive card usage.

accounts.Title: Currency Diversification
Tips: If you have accounts in different currencies, place money in the currency that is most convenient for current expenses or investments.
Consider possible fluctuations in currency exchange rates and plan your actions accordingly.

accounts.Title: Create an Emergency Fund
Tips: Set aside a certain percentage of income into a savings account that will be used only in case of emergencies.

accounts.Title: Invest
Tips: Consider investment opportunities to increase your capital.
Diversification of investments will help reduce risks.

accounts.Title: Track Your Expenses
Tips: Use banking apps or financial tools to track your expenses.
Analyse your spending to identify areas where you can save.

accounts.Title: Plan for Retirement
Tips: Consider setting up a retirement account or investments to ensure financial stability in old age.

accounts.Title: Assess Your Debts
Tips: Regularly assess your debts and work on paying them off.
Avoid accumulating high-interest debts.

accounts.Title: Review Your Financial Goals
Tips: Periodically review your financial goals and adjust your strategies according to changes in life circumstances.

planning.Title: Budgeting
Tips: Develop a monthly budget, including all your expenses and income.
Track your financial transactions to understand where your money is going.

planning.Title: Spending Priorities
Tips: Set priorities for your spending, prioritizing essential needs over desired purchases.
Categorize expenses into mandatory, necessary, and additional to better plan your budget.

planning.Title: Saving on Everyday Expenses
Tips: Look for ways to save on everyday expenses, such as food, transportation, and entertainment.
Consider using discounts, deals, and loyalty programs to reduce expenses.

planning.Title: Financial Goals
Tips: Set specific financial goals, such as savings for emergencies, vacations, or large purchases.
Develop a plan to achieve your financial goals and monitor its implementation.

planning.Title: Avoiding Excess
Tips: Avoid excess and unnecessary spending, considering the necessity of each purchase.
Prefer quality over quantity and make thoughtful purchases.

planning.Title: Regular Budget Review
Tips: Periodically review your budget, taking into account changes in income and expenses.
Make adjustments to the budget to reflect your current financial situation.

planning.Title: Financial Education
Tips: Invest time in financial education to better understand your options and make informed financial decisions.
Read books, attend webinars, and consult with financial experts when necessary.

credits.Title: Credit Management
Tips: Assess your financial capability before taking out a loan: consider monthly incomes and mandatory expenses.
Compare the terms of various credit offers, including interest rates, terms, and additional costs.

credits.Title: Contract Examination
Tips: Thoroughly examine the contract before signing, paying attention to hidden conditions and penalties.

credits.Title: Debt-to-Income Ratio
Tips: Strive to maintain a debt payment to income ratio that does not exceed 30%.

credits.Title: Timely Repayment
Tips: Repay loans on time to avoid penalties and improve your credit history.

credits.Title: Alternative Options
Tips: Consider alternative financing options such as credit unions or peer-to-peer lending platforms.

credits.Title: Purchase Planning
Tips: Plan major purchases in advance to avoid unexpected credit obligations.

credits.Title: Professional Advice
Tips: Seek professional advice when needed, especially when choosing mortgage loans or major investments.
